job_title: Adjunct Facility and Learning Center Assistant in Omaha, NE
pros: They had the best benefits anywhere.  If I needed to leave for an appt. or emergency, all I had to do was work it out with my supervisor.  I never had a problem with this.  No one was looking over my shoulder.  The students were my evaluated me.  They had a certain number of training hours you had to complete during the year.  It was reasonable and very helpful.
cons: None.  I loved working there.  I wish I could teach online.  I resign  to leave due to a disability years ago.  I have never gone a day without missing my best job ever.

pros:
Great staff, faculty, and students
Good insurance
Good environment and purposeful work.
cons: Horrible pay and a horrible supervisor in my department.  The supervisor in my small department was very uncaring towards my needs when I had an emergency come up.  I had a family emergency come up that affected my kids and she wasn't willing to let me come in 30 minutes early to work so I could leave 30 minutes early when I was supposed to get off, even though we had plenty of coverage in the office.  Her reasoning for this decision was that we have to follow the schedule no matter what.  I was jaw was hanging open when she said that.

review_title: Great place to work...has pros and cons like any job.
pros: Family atmosphere, personally rewarding to help students, great benefits (especially vacation and sick leave), job security, flexibility in most departments, embraces diversity,
cons: Pay is less in education field than in general business, family insurance is expensive (but very good), difficult to move within the organization because they do not have a high turnover.

pros: Pay is good for part-time regular especially if this is a extra income position
cons: My department has almost completely turned over regarding regular staff in less than 5 years (at least 90% or more).  I am nearly the most senior.  This should be very telling to the executive admins about leadership in this department.

review_title: A company that works WITH me.
job_title: Math Tutor in Kansas City, MO
pros:
All of my supervisors were very open and welcoming.

No one there is any kind of discriminatory.

My supervisors are very good about being straight forward when I'm doing something wrong, and also give many praises when I'm doing well.

When I was having personal problems, they understood, listened, and were lenient enough to let me figure it all out. I was almost certain that I would be fired because of how much my issues were affecting my work ethic.
cons: The pay could definitely be better, but I love my job and it's such a great experience.

review_title: This position is OK to start with when getting into the IT industry.
job_title: Lab Assistant in Lees Summit, MO
pros:
Lots of downtime.
Steady hours.
Free software due to MSDNAA.
cons:
Limited to maximum of 1000 hours worked per year.
No benefits at all.
Downtime can get very boring at points.
Students can have unreal expectations of what you are actually supposed to do in regards to their homework.

review_title: Not many classes to go around.
pros: If you can get some classes it's a good part time job. Pay is good and management is flexible enough to let me make changes to the syllabus.
cons: Adjunct faculty classes are hard to keep. Students tend to be regular community college types so you can go multiple quarters before getting somebody who really is passionate.

job_title: Educational Support Specialist in Omaha, NE
pros: The staff and students are great to work with. There are some people there who really try hard to get the job done the right way.
cons: It might seem strange for an organization that large to be underfunded, but it seems as though across the board in all departments that work is just piled on to every one and that they could use more people.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Omaha, NE
pros: Easy going culture, lots of autonomy and able to structure and add to classroom instruction. Workshops and learning communities.  Ability to choose what campus  to teach at (as an adjunct) Nice people.
cons: Poor pay. As an adjunct there are no benefits.  Don't see much support from manager for advancement. very strict about credentials.

review_title: A great place to teach where the Administration has mostly a hands-off management style.

cons: Excellent teachers aren't rewarded or even encouraged. Poor teachers-even abusive teachers are rarely disciplined and NEVER fired.

pros: I love the workplace environment. The teamwork dynamic within my department has a natural flow, providing support and encouragement at all times.
